abstract.text: A mutable object that represents an audiovisual container that conforms to the QuickTime movie file format or a related format like MPEG-4.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This class is a mutable subclass of

that provides methods that support movie editing. For example, you can use a mutable movie to copy media data from one track and paste it into another. You can also use this object to create track references from one track to another (for example, to set one track as a chapter track of another track). To perform editing operations on individual tracks, use the associated classes

You use movie objects only when operating on format-specific features of a QuickTime or ISO base media file. You typically don’t use these classes to open and play QuickTime movie files or ISO base media files. Instead, you use

When performing media insertions, a movie interleaves media data from tracks in the source asset to optimize the movie file for playback. However, performing a series of media insertions may result in a movie file that’s not optimally interleaved. You can optimize a movie file for playback by exporting it with an

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
A preset to export the asset in its current format, unless otherwise prohibited.
An object that exports assets in a format that you specify using an export preset.
A Boolean value that indicates whether to optimize the movie for network use.
A protocol that defines the interface to load media data asynchronously.
An object that represents an audiovisual container that conforms to the QuickTime movie file format or a related format like MPEG-4.
A track in a movie that conforms to the QuickTime or ISO base media file format.
A mutable object that represents an audiovisual container that conforms to the QuickTime movie file format or a related format like MPEG-4.
Adds an empty track to the target movie.
Adds one or more empty tracks to the target movie and copies the track settings from the source tracks.

The metadata formats this asset contains.
A Boolean value that indicates whether you can extend the asset by fragments.
Returns an array of chapters with a locale that best matches the list of preferred languages.
Returns an array of chapters that contain the specified title locale and common keys.
The metadata items an asset contains for common metadata identifiers that provide a value.
A Boolean value that indicates whether at least one movie fragment extends the asset.
A metadata item that indicates the asset’s creation date.
The default storage container for media data that you add to a movie.
A time value that indicates the asset’s duration.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the asset contains protected content.

A time period indicating the duration for interleaving runs of samples for each track.

A Boolean value that indicates whether you can export this asset using an export session.

A Boolean value that indicates whether the asset has playable content.
A Boolean value that indicates whether you can extract the asset’s media data using an asset reader.

The lyrics of the asset in a language suitable for the current locale.

An array of metadata items for all metadata identifiers for which a value is available.
Returns an array of metadata items from the container with the specified format.
A time value that indicates how closely playback follows the latest live stream content.
